items.sentence: You\'re upset and you have every right to be.
Tom doesn\'t like the way John looks at Mary.
Tom doesn\'t like to talk about his problems.
Tom doesn\'t like to talk about what he does.
Tom doesn\'t look like either of his parents.
Thank you for everything you\'ve done for me.
That house with the red roof is Tom\'s house.
Canadians don\'t usually do things like that.
What you don\'t want to do is make Tom angry.
What you\'re suggesting is simply ridiculous.
What\'s in this box could be worth a fortune.
Tom, what did you do to make your sister cry?
I have plenty of things to eat in the pantry.
I wanted Tom to come to Boston for Christmas.
I wanted Tom to find out where Mary had been.
I wanted Tom to give me more time to do that.
I wanted to ask you some questions about Tom.
I wanted to be the first to congratulate you.
I think you\'ve mistaken me for someone else.
I think you\'ve read too many romance novels.
